result.execSummary:
The defendant Darren J. KLEIN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court will entertain a motion for early discharge from probation if assessment and follow through is completed and it is recommended by the agent.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Provide DNA sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darren J. KLEIN

Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 08-27-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Plea date is set for 11-04-15 at 10:30 a.m.  
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Darren J. KLEIN
Current: 508 Buffalo Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 07-23-2015)
Prior: 413 N. 5th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220

Defendant in custody on arrest warrant.  The matter is continued for an initial appearance on 07-27-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he maintain absolute sobriety.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Arrest warrant with service of officer thereon.
